snippet: Neiman’s revenue was $1.43 billion during its second quarter, which ended Feb. 1, an increase from the same period last year, when revenue was $1.36 billion.
abstract: Neiman Marcus reports rise in second-quarter sales, during what was difficult season for retailers; second-quarter revenue was $1.43 billion, up from $1.36 billion year ago; nonetheless, company posts second-quarter loss of $67.95 million, compared with profits of $40.4 million year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Neiman’s revenue was $1.43 billion during its second quarter, which ended Feb. 1, an increase from the same period last year, when revenue was $1.36 billion.

headline.main: Rise in Sales for Neiman, Despite Loss
